item.title: Protecting our Communities from Failure to Secure the Border Act of 2023

latestAction.text: Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.

item.title: No Funds for Iranian Terrorism Act

latestAction.text: Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Foreign Relations.

item.title: A joint resolution providing for congressional disapproval under chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, of the rule submitted by the Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection relating to "Small Business Lending Under the Equal Credit Opportunity Act (Regulation B)".

latestAction.text: Failed of passage in Senate over veto by Yea-Nay Vote. 54 - 45. Record Vote Number: 5.

item.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 212 - 205, 1 Present (Roll no. 679). (text: CR H5945-5946)
Passed/agreed to in House: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 212 - 205, 1 Present (Roll no. 679). (text: CR H5945-5946)
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 213 - 205, 1 Present (Roll no. 678).
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 891.
Considered as privileged matter. (consideration: CR H5945-5956)
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 51.

The resolution provides for consideration of H.R. 5283 and H.R. 5961 under a structured rule and S. J. Res. 32 under a closed rule. Rule provides for one hour of general debate on each measure with one motion to recommit on H.R. 5283 and H.R. 5961 and one motion to commit on S. J. Res. 32.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 118-280, by Mr. Reschenthaler.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 118-280, by Mr. Reschenthaler.

cdata.text: Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 5283) to prohibit the use of Federal funds to provide housing to specified aliens on any land under the administrative jurisdiction of the Federal land management agencies; providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 5961) to freeze certain Iranian funds involved in the 2023 hostage deal between the United States and Iran, and for other purposes; and providing for consideration of the joint resolution (S. J. Res. 32) providing for congressional disapproval under chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, of the rule submitted by the Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection relating to "Small Business Lending Under the Equal Credit Opportunity Act (Regulation B)".

This resolution sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 5283) to prohibit the use of federal funds to provide housing to specified aliens on any land under the administrative jurisdiction of the federal land management agencies; providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 5961) to freeze certain Iranian funds involved in the 2023 hostage deal between the United States and Iran, and for other purposes; and providing for consideration of the joint resolution (S. J. Res. 32) providing for congressional disapproval of the rule submitted by the Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection relating to Small Business Lending Under the Equal Credit Opportunity Act (Regulation B).

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
